docstr: `INT8` — Convert to 64-bit integer type ### Description Convert to a `KIND=8` integer type. This is equivalent to the standard `INT` intrinsic with an optional argument of `KIND=8`, and is only included for backwards compatibility. ### Syntax `RESULT = INT8(A)` ### Arguments , `REAL`, or `COMPLEX`. ### Return value The return value is a `INTEGER(8)` variable. ### Standard GNU extension ### Class Elemental function ### See also INT, INT2, LONG

`INT8` — Convert to 64-bit integer type ### Description Convert to a `KIND=8` integer type. This is equivalent to the standard `INT` intrinsic with an optional argument of `KIND=8`, and is only included for backwards compatibility. ### Syntax `RESULT = INT8(A)` ### Arguments , `REAL`, or `COMPLEX`. ### Return value The return value is a `INTEGER(8)` variable. ### Standard GNU extension ### Class Elemental function ### See also INT, INT2, LONG
